intro: Omphalissa, commonly known as the "heartleaf" or "heart-shaped plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves, which are often glossy and deeply lobed. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or white in color. Omphalissa is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
